5) The pilot retracts the landing Gear

options.text: store it onto a medium designed to survive an accident.
show any malfunctions on the Primary Flight Display.
transmit it to ground stations for engineering analysis.
automatically erase it after landing.

IN27i0OR.question:
The voice recorder records on four different channels the following information
1) aural warnings.
2) radio communications.
3) conversations between the crew members through the cockpit interphone.
4) announcements to the passengers.The combination re-grouping all the correct statements is

lTRtzXyn.question: Parameters recorded by a Flight Data Recorder include...

options.text: attitude, heading, and thrust/power on each engine.
airspeed, attitude, and announcements by cabin crew members.
time or relative time count, aural cockpit warnings, and airspeed.
landing gear position, pressure altitude, and pilot communications.

bZhCN7ST.question: The Flight Data Recorder (FDR) shall preserve the flight deck conversations and aural warnings of the last...

options.text: 30 minutes of operation.
25 hours of operation.
48 hours of operation.
Sector.

qjKeMBvv.question: When pressing the push button EVENT on the unit control of flight data recorder

options.text: a mark is set on the recording, enabling this event to be found rapidly at a subsequent analysis.
the recording is automatically stopped upon this event.
the recording is rewound so that whatever happens after this event is recorded.
a event mark is set on the recording, after that the recording is automatically stopped.
a tape recorder, Underwater Locating Device, area microphone, and control unit.
an Underwater Locating Device, illuminating light, speakers, tape recorder, and control unit.
an Event Mark Device, Emergency Locator Transmitter, test button, and erase button.
a Digital Flight Data Acquisition Unit, area microphone, erase button, and tape recorder.

dUceFblb.question: The purpose of a Flight Data Monitoring (FDM) programme is to collect flight data...

options.text: anonymously, to improve safety.
to measure all crew member's performance.
individually, for the safety evaluation of each pilot.
individually, to measure each pilot's performance.

Lj3EluKm.question:
According to the EU-OPS regulations, the Cockpit Voice Recorder of a 50 seat multi-engined aircraft having been granted the airworthiness certificate after 1st April 1998 will record:
 
1. The radiotelephonic communications transmitted or received by the cockpit crew
2. The audio environment of the cockpit
3. The cabin attendants communications in the cabin via the interphone
4. The flight crew members communications in the cockpit via the interphone
5. The flight crew members communications in the cockpit via the public address system
6. The audio signals identifiying the navigation or approach aids
 
The combination regrouping the correct statements is:

p80GK4wY.question: A Cockpit Voice Recorder (CVR) will record:

options.text: Voice communications transmitted from or received on the flight deck, the aural environment of the flight deck, voice communication of flight crew members using the aeroplane’s interphone system, voice or audio signals introduced into a headset or speaker, voice communication of flight crew members using the public address system, when installed.

Flight data, voice communications transmitted from or received on the flight deck, the aural environment of the flight deck, voice communication of flight crew members using the aeroplane’s interphone system, voice or audio signals introduced into a headset or speaker, voice communication of flight crew members using the public address system, when installed.

voice communications transmitted from or received on the flight deck, the aural environment of the flight deck, voice communication of flight and cabin crew members using the aeroplane’s interphone system, voice or audio signals introduced into a headset or speaker, voice communication of flight and cabin crew members using the public address system, when installed.

Voice communications transmitted from or received on the flight deck, the aural environment of the flight deck, voice communication of flight crew members using the aeroplane’s interphone system, flight parameters, voice or audio signals introduced into a headset or speaker, voice communication of flight crew members using the public address system, when installed.

vdrsNxbi.question: A Flight Data Recorder together with an ACMS (Aeroplane Condition Monitoring System) can be used for..

options.text: accident analysis and trouble-shooting.
transmitting aircraft location data to ground stations during flight.
relaying pilot communications to ground stations.
sending cockpit aural warnings to the operator`s maintenance base.

m7ntnQRs.question:
According to EASA AIR OPS and CS25, a CVR (Cockpit Voice Recorder) must record:
1) communications transmitted from or received in the aeroplane by radio.
2) communications of flight-crew members on the flight deck.
3) communications of flight-crew members on the flight deck using the aeroplane's interphone system.
4) audio signals identifying navigation or approach aids introduced into a headset or speaker.
The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:

iP2B5ihD.question: When must the flight data recorder start data recording automatically?

options.text: Before the airplane is able to move under its own power.
When taking-off.
When lining up.
When the landing gear is retracted.

z5fXY1q3.question: If the Radio Altimeter fails during an autoland approach

options.text: the RA stops showing the height.
an audio alert sounds.
the DH flashes.
the DH flashes and an audio alert sounds.

kNUuYKJK.question: What is the purpose of a Flight Data Recorder (FDR)?

options.text: Collect and record data from a variety of aircraft sensors onto a medium which is designed to survive an accident.
Send information data to engineers on the ground to analysis recorded data.
Show errors or malfunctions of instruments on the primary flight display (PFD).
Erase recorded data when on ground after landing.

eYnpxRMb.question: What is the purpose of a Flight Data Recorder (FDR)?

options.text: Collection of altitude, heading, speeds etc. for investigation of an accident.
Recording of cockpit sounds for incident and accident investigations.
Serving as evidence for insurance issues following personal injury or serious material damage.
Monitoring of flight parameters for maintenance purposes.

Hb9t2Bo8.question: What is the purpose of a Flight Data Recorder (FDR)?

options.text: The data collected in the FDR can help investigators determine the cause of an accident.
The FDR records flight data in order to improve the safety of flight operations.
The FDR records all voice communication on the flight deck to help investigators to identify the cause of an incident or accident.
The data collected in the FDR is used by engineers to monitor aircraft performance and anticipate an impending system failure.

RgCCZaF2.question: Which of the following are factors that determine the type and number of parameters to be recorded by a FDR (flight data recorder)?

options.text: Recording capacity and applicable operational requirements.
Recording duration and reliability of the FDR.
Recording capacity and number of flight crew members.
Recording duration and the maximum flight time of the aircraft.
